SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

fr.enstb.xmlcode
Class XMLDecoder

java.lang.Object
  fr.enstb.xmlcode.XMLDecoder

public class XMLDecoder
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class providing XML decoding facilities

This class allow you to decode object to an XML string or streams according to a mapping you define externaly (see XMLMapping). Objects are automatically instancied from XML strings or streams.
Supposing you have your data in an object myData (a string or a stream object), decoding process is as simpler as this: 
 XMLMapping myMapping = new XMLMapping(modelFile);
 
 MyClass myObject = (MyClass) XMLDecoder.decodeObjectWithMapping(myData, myMapping);
or directly by specifying model file: 
 MyClass myObject = (MyClass) XMLDecoder.decodeObjectWithMappingFile(myData, modelFile);
where myData is either a String or an mInputStream and
In this example, a new instance of MyClass class is instancied and automatically sets with values and newly created instances of others sub-classes.

Author:
Sylvain Guerin
See Also:
XMLCoder, XMLMapping

                            throws java.io.IOException

Returns:
a boolean value
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if an error occurs (independantly of well-forming)
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - if an error occurs (independantly of well-forming)
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs (independantly of well-forming)
